message.msgstr: Port range forwarding is useful for web servers, ftp servers, e-mail servers, gaming and other specialized Internet applications. When you enable the port range forwarding, the communication requests from the Internet to your routerâ€™s WAN port will be forwarded to the specified LAN IP address.

message.msgid: Please specify a valid start/end port value between 1-65535! Start port must be smaller than end port!
message.msgstr: Please specify a valid start/end port value between 1-65535! Start port must be smaller than end port!

message.msgid: Can not use the router's IP address!
message.msgstr: Can not use the router's IP address!

message.msgid: Please enter a valid IP address. DMZ Host IP address should be on the same IP net segment as the device's LAN IP and they should be different!
message.msgstr: Please enter a valid IP address. DMZ Host IP address should be on the same IP net segment as the device's LAN IP and they should be different!
NOTE: When the DMZ host is enabled, the firewall settings of the DMZ host will not function.

message.msgid: Please complete all fields with your correct DDNS account information!
message.msgstr: Please complete all fields with your correct DDNS account information!

message.msgid: Up to %s static routing entries are supported!
message.msgstr: Up to %s static routing entries are supported!

message.msgid: The static routing entry already exists!
message.msgstr: The static routing entry already exists!
